creator: Julie Bort
title: (No AI) Salesforce CEO Marc Benioff: This isn’t our first SaaSpocalypse

content: Salesforce reported a solid year-end earnings and then pulled out all the stops to ward off more talk of the death of its business to AI.

creator: Jagmeet Singh
title: (No AI) Gushwork bets on AI search for customer leads — and early results are emerging
dc:creator: Jagmeet Singh
content: Gushwork has raised $9 million in a seed round led by SIG and Lightspeed. The startup has seen early customer traction from AI search tools like ChatGPT.
contentSnippet: Gushwork has raised $9 million in a seed round led by SIG and Lightspeed. The startup has seen early customer traction from AI search tools like ChatGPT.

title: (No AI) Burger King will use AI to check if employees say ‘please’ and ‘thank you’
author: Emma Roth
content:
![A Burger King employee](https://platform.theverge.com/wp-content/uploads/sites/2/2026/02/BK-Assistant-Image-2.png?quality=90&strip=all&crop=0,0,100,100)

Burger King is launching an AI chatbot that will live in the headsets used by employees. The voice-enabled chatbot, called "Patty," is part of an overarching BK Assistant platform that will not only assist employees with meal preparation but also evaluate their interactions with customers for "friendliness."

Thibault Roux, Burger King's chief digital officer, tells _The Verge_ that the company compiled information from franchisees and guests on how to measure friendliness, resulting in the fast food chain training its AI system to recognize certain words and phrases, such as "welcome to Burger King," "please," and "thank you." Managers can th …

[Read the full story at The Verge.](https://www.theverge.com/ai-artificial-intelligence/884911/burger-king-ai-assistant-patty)
contentSnippet:
Burger King is launching an AI chatbot that will live in the headsets used by employees. The voice-enabled chatbot, called "Patty," is part of an overarching BK Assistant platform that will not only assist employees with meal preparation but also evaluate their interactions with customers for "friendliness."
Thibault Roux, Burger King's chief digital officer, tells The Verge that the company compiled information from franchisees and guests on how to measure friendliness, resulting in the fast food chain training its AI system to recognize certain words and phrases, such as "welcome to Burger King," "please," and "thank you." Managers can th …
Read the full story at The Verge.

title: (No AI) Google takes control of ‘Android of robotics’ project in quest for physical AI
author: Robert Hart
content:
![](https://platform.theverge.com/wp-content/uploads/sites/2/2026/02/unnamed.webp?quality=90&strip=all&crop=0,0,100,100)

Google is folding Alphabet's AI robotics "moonshot," Intrinsic, into the company after five years as an independent unit. The move marks a strategic shift as Google doubles down on physical AI and pulls experimental projects closer to its core business.

Intrinsic "[graduated](https://x.company/projects/intrinsic/)" [into an independent company](https://www.theverge.com/2021/7/23/22590109/google-intrinsic-industrial-robotics-company-software) inside Alphabet's Other Bets division in 2021, a portfolio of high-risk, speculative ventures that also includes robotaxi firm Waymo and healthcare company Verily. It pitches itself as an Android-like layer for robotics, building software and tools that make it easier to create robot applications.

  
Details of the purchase are not clear but t …

[Read the full story at The Verge.](https://www.theverge.com/tech/885113/google-swallows-ai-robotics-moonshot-intrinsic)

Google is folding Alphabet's AI robotics "moonshot," Intrinsic, into the company after five years as an independent unit. The move marks a strategic shift as Google doubles down on physical AI and pulls experimental projects closer to its core business. 
Intrinsic "graduated" into an independent company inside Alphabet's Other Bets division in 2021, a portfolio of high-risk, speculative ventures that also includes robotaxi firm Waymo and healthcare company Verily. It pitches itself as an Android-like layer for robotics, building software and tools that make it easier to create robot applications.
Details of the purchase are not clear but t …
Read the full story at The Verge.

title: (No AI) A new way to express yourself: Gemini can now create music

creator: Maxwell Zeff, Maddy Varner
title: (No AI) Riley Walz, the Jester of Silicon Valley, Is Joining OpenAI
dc:creator: Maxwell Zeff, Maddy Varner
content: The software engineer is famous for his online stunts. Now he’s joining the company behind ChatGPT to work on new ways for humans to use AI systems.
